title: The Dog Who Cried Peach
narrative_story: A remarkable dog discovered a portent: the sky was raining peaches. The pooch sat in silence, watching fruit fall, then began to cry from the weight of knowing. The villagers detested him for his smell and his knowing, until the cow stepped forward to declare: 'A vast change is coming!' The dog remembered what came before—the last time peaches fell—and went to wash himself, preparing for what was next.
narrative_arc: A prophetic dog witnesses a peach rain, endures rejection, and prepares while others merely declare
callbacks: Dog returns as a crazy companion in Lesson 12

characters.narrative_position: It began with a PORTENT—cracks in the sky, whispers in the wind
characters.mnemonic_image: Cracks spreading through oracle bone - the shape of fate revealed
characters.story: I trace my finger across the PORTENT carved in turtle shell. 'JAOWW!' I COMMAND the cracks to change - but they spell my death date, immutable as stone.

characters.narrative_position: Then came the PEACHES—falling like sweet, fuzzy rain
characters.mnemonic_image: Wood radical + portent = the fruit that wards off evil... or announces it
characters.sound_bridge: TAOW = 'TOW the line between life and death'
characters.story: A PEACH dangles before my blade. I GASP 'TAOW?!' - is this my last meal before execution? The pit contains a worm, writhing.
characters.tone_emotion: GASP - rising horror at the condemned fruit

characters.narrative_position: The POOCH saw it first—sharper than other dogs
characters.mnemonic_image: Pictograph of a dog with one leg raised - the beast that smells death
characters.story: The DOG circles my cooling corpse. I GROAN 'Chwannnn...' from somewhere outside my body - low and creaky - watching it tear the first strip of flesh.
characters.tone_emotion: GROAN - guttural observation of one's own devouring

characters.narrative_position: He was REMARKABLE—sharper than other dogs
characters.mnemonic_image: A figure with an extra appendage - grotesquely exceptional
characters.story: My tumor is REMARKABLE - the surgeon's never seen its like. I GASP 'YOW?!' as he shows me its impossible size, pulsing with its own heartbeat.
characters.tone_emotion: GASP - rising disbelief at the aberration

characters.narrative_position: He sat in SILENCE for a long time, watching the fruit fall
characters.mnemonic_image: Black + dog = the hound that makes no sound before striking
characters.story: The black dog's SILENCE terrifies me more than growling would. 'MWOH!' I COMMAND it to bark, to snarl, anything - but it just stares with eyes that have seen my death.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - desperate order to break the terrible quiet

characters.narrative_position: This was a SORT OF THING that had never happened before
characters.mnemonic_image: Flesh + dog + fire below = it is naturally thus that flesh burns
characters.sound_bridge: RANN = 'RAN out of options, it is thus'
characters.story: 'It is THUS, naturally so,' the executioner explains. I GASP 'RANN?!' - how can burning alive be the natural order? But the pyre is already lit.
characters.tone_emotion: GASP - rising horror at cosmic indifference

characters.narrative_position: Then he began TO CRY—not from sadness, but from the weight of knowing
characters.mnemonic_image: Two mouths weeping + dog = the howl of grief
characters.story: I CRY over the body of my child, SINGING 'KOOOOO!' - a sustained wail that will never end, not in this life, not in the next, not ever.
characters.tone_emotion: SING - sustained grief that goes on forever

characters.narrative_position: The villagers grabbed every UTENSIL they could find to catch the peaches
characters.mnemonic_image: Four mouths surrounding a dog - a container for howling
characters.story: Four mouths surround me - I am their VESSEL, their tool. 'CHEE!' they COMMAND in unison, and I shatter into useful pieces for their pleasure.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - sharp order that breaks the self

characters.narrative_position: But the dog was STINKING—he'd rolled in something foul that morning
characters.mnemonic_image: Self/nose + dog = the smell a hound follows to decay
characters.story: The STINKING rot fills my nostrils - my own decomposition. 'CHOWW!' I COMMAND my nose to stop smelling - but decay has no off switch, only an end.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - futile order to one's own rotting flesh

characters.narrative_position: The other DOGS avoided him—even the peaches seemed to fall elsewhere
characters.mnemonic_image: Dog radical + hook = the common hound, less noble than 犬
characters.story: The DOG drags my severed arm across the courtyard. I GROAN 'Gowww...' - low and guttural - still somehow watching from the dirt where my head rolled.
characters.tone_emotion: GROAN - low observation from one's own severed head

characters.narrative_position: The villagers grew TO DETEST him—his smell, his crying, his knowing
characters.mnemonic_image: Cliff + flesh covered by dog = what lies beneath, detestable
characters.story: I DETEST what my family has become. 'YANN!' I COMMAND them to stop - but the cannibals keep chewing my sister's thigh, grinning with red teeth.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - sharp rejection of the abhorrent

characters.narrative_position: PRESSURE mounted—someone had to explain this miracle
characters.story: The PRESSURE of collapsing earth is total, absolute. I SING 'YAHHHH!' - sustained and unending as the mine shaft buries me alive, one breath at a time.
characters.tone_emotion: SING - sustained scream under crushing weight

characters.narrative_position: The COW stepped forward—she was the village oracle
characters.mnemonic_image: Pictograph of cow with horns - the beast bound for slaughter
characters.sound_bridge: NYOW = 'NOW it's the cow's turn to die'
characters.story: The COW's eyes meet mine in the slaughter line. I GASP 'NYOW?!' - we both know which of us dies today, but only I pretend otherwise.
characters.tone_emotion: GASP - rising recognition of shared mortality

characters.mnemonic_image: Cow + temple = specially selected for sacrifice
characters.story: I am SPECIAL - chosen above all others for sacrifice. 'TUH!' the priest COMMANDS, marking my forehead. I finally understand what 'special' truly costs.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - sharp designation of the doomed

characters.narrative_position: She began TO DECLARE: 'This is a sign! A vast change is coming!'
characters.mnemonic_image: Cow + mouth = the beast's final bellow, a declaration
characters.story: I DECLARE my final words to the crowd. 'GAOW!' I COMMAND them to remember - but the executioner's blade is already falling, my declaration cut short.

characters.mnemonic_image: Water + declare = waters so vast they make their own declaration
characters.story: The VAST flood swallows my village whole. 'HAOW!' I COMMAND the waters to stop - but vastness does not listen to small voices drowning.
characters.tone_emotion: COMMAND - futile order to indifferent immensity

characters.narrative_position: He remembered what came BEFORE—the last time peaches fell
characters.mnemonic_image: Above + legs walking = the one who walks ahead into death
characters.sound_bridge: SHYAN = 'SHE'AN be the first to die'
characters.story: I was here BEFORE you were born, and I'll remain after. I SING 'SHYANNNN!' - sustained and eternal - as civilizations rise and fall around my grave.

characters.narrative_position: So he went TO WASH himself in the river, preparing for what was next
characters.mnemonic_image: Water + before = washing what came before, cleansing the past
characters.story: I WASH my hands of my children's blood. I GROAN 'Sheee...' - low and creaky - but Lady Macbeth was right: the stain never truly leaves.
characters.tone_emotion: GROAN - guttural guilt that won't wash clean
